question: According to Mahavamsa and Dipavamsa, Ashoka was converted to Buddhism by which of the following?
explanation: According to Buddhist texts Mahavamsa and Dipavamsa, Ashoka was converted to Buddhism by his nephew Nigrodha Nigrodha became a monk at the tender age of 7. According to the Divyavadana, Samudra who was a merchant -turned-monk converted Ashoka.
